Name: Bronze Figurine
Description: A bronze statuette of the goddess Isis seated with the child Horus. The goddess wears a crown and uraeus over a long wig. Her face is finely modelled and the eyes and necklace are inlaid with gold. She is dressed in a long, close-fitting robe, her feet rest on a square pedestal and she wears anklets. Horus is seated on her knee, suckling, he wears a skull-cap with uraeus and side-lock. His hands are against his thighs.
